channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Homeland Security Says Border Patrol Operation in Charlotte Is Not Over
item.description: The mayor and sheriff said earlier in the day that the operation appeared to have concluded. But a homeland security spokeswoman said that the effort ...

item.title: Trump Plans to Open More Than a Billion Acres of U.S. Waters to Drilling
item.description: The plan from the Interior Department is one of the president’s most significant steps yet to increase domestic fossil fuel production.

item.title: Exclusive: Former BlackRock employees raise $4.6 million for HelloTrade, a blockchain-powered trading platform
item.description: The startup aims to allow people around the world to invest in traditional U.S. assets using crypto technology

item.title: Home Depot blames its recent sales slump on a major funk in the housing market: ‘Our customers are homeowners’
item.description: The U.S. housing market is currently experiencing historic stagnation.

item.title: Trump tells Scott Bessent to fix the Fed’s high interest rates or ‘I’m going to fire your ass’
item.description: The president also disclosed for the first time that Bessent has been advocating for Powell to remain as chair until his term expires in May.

item.title: Stocks Tumble as Early Tech Rally Gives Way to Worries
item.description: After a week of market uneasiness, Nvidia’s profit surge and Walmart’s earnings had initially offered investors relief. But the bullishness faded by T...

item.title: Judge Temporarily Blocks Trump From Deploying National Guard in D.C.
item.description: Judge Jia M. Cobb found that the presence of more than 2,000 National Guard troops, many from outside D.C., was most likely unlawful. She paused the o...

item.title: Trump Calling Reporter ‘Piggy’ Was ‘Frankness,’ White House Says
item.description: Karoline Leavitt, the White House press secretary, addressed for the first time a schoolyard insult that President Trump lobbed at a Bloomberg News re...

item.title: South Korean banks offer baby bonuses, flexible schedules, and years-long sabbaticals while U.S. women leave the workforce in droves
item.description: Some South Korean banks are offering “parental resignation” programs while America’s RTO shift is forcing women out of their jobs.

item.title: Morality matters, even to Cuomo voters
item.description: In the latest elections, 2 million New Yorkers voted. But for some, the choice left a lingering sense of discomfort.

item.title: Ambassador Huckabee Held Meeting With Jonathan Pollard, Ex-Spy, at U.S. Embassy in Israel
item.description: Jonathan J. Pollard, who was convicted of espionage, said in an interview that the meeting, which was highly unusual for a U.S. diplomat to attend, ha...

item.title: Trump to Send U.S. Official to G20 in South Africa After All
item.description: The South African president suggested Washington had decided to participate in the summit, despite an earlier claim of a boycott.

item.title: Nigerian Student Describes Hiding From Kidnappers at School
item.description: The girl hid in a toilet; another managed to sneak away. Security forces are still trying to rescue the 24 girls who were abducted in northwestern Nig...

item.title: Ukraine and Europe Chafe at Being Excluded From U.S.-Russian Peace Plan
item.description: Some in Kyiv expressed confusion over the Trump administration’s multiple diplomatic tracks as Washington tries to revive negotiations.

item.title: Want to Immigrate to the UK? The Government Says You Must Earn It.
item.description: The government plans to double the period needed for many legal immigrants to become permanent residents, while cutting it for higher-rate taxpayers.
